title: Salesforce Co-CEO Bret Taylor to Step Down
description: Marc Benioff will become the business-software company’s sole chief executive.

title: TikTok Chief Touts Customer Data-Privacy Initiatives
description: The unit of Beijing-based ByteDance has faced questions over the influence of the Chinese government on how its video-sharing platform secures user data.

title: 'The Bezos Blueprint' Review: Is Brevity the Soul of Success?
description: Short sentences, written so an eighth-grader could understand. Turns out the secret to Amazon’s success isn’t logistical, it’s lexical.

title: Zuckerberg Says Apple Holds Too Much Control Over App Ecosystem
description: The Meta chief executive remains optimistic about his company’s metaverse products and services.

title: Shaken or Stirred? Let Your New Robot Bartender Decide
description: Bartesian’s mechanical mixologist promises to produce a wide range of cocktails at a blazingly fast pace. In our test, the results tasted better than you might expect.

title: Amazon CEO Has No Regrets on Hiring Spree as Layoffs Start
description: Andy Jassy added that the tech giant won’t compromise on long-term investments.

title: EU Official Says Changes Are Needed at Twitter
description: Thierry Breton, EU internal market commissioner, held a video call with Elon Musk to discuss a new law governing social-media platforms and content moderation. “There is still huge work ahead,” he said.

title: Twitter Becomes Stage for China Protests Despite Ban by Beijing
description: The platform is proving to be a critical avenue for those who seek to broadcast images of demonstrations to the world.

title: Honda Plans New Autonomous Features but Sees Long Road Ahead to Self-Driving Cars
description: The auto maker said it would focus for now on partially autonomous driving technology to improve safety, joining others that say fully self-driving cars aren’t ready for prime time.

title: GM's Cruise Seeks Regulatory OK to Test Shuttle With No Steering Wheel
description: The driverless-car firm is seeking permission from the California DMV to deploy its Origin shuttles on public roads as test vehicles on San Francisco streets.

title: iPhone 14 Pro Shortage: Ways to Find One by Christmas
description: Covid restrictions and unrest at Apple’s largest iPhone assembly factory in China has resulted in longer wait times for the new high-end iPhones—unless you get clever with some tricks.

title: Early Alameda Staffers Quit Over Risk, Compliance Concerns
description: “We ended up not really knowing how much money we even had,” one former employee said.

title: India's Central Bank to Launch Retail Pilot of Digital Rupee
description: Digital rupee tokens will be issued in the same denominations as paper currency or coins and users can transact with merchants or other users through a digital wallet issued by participating banks.

title: Elon Musk's Neuralink Set to 'Show and Tell' Latest Brain-Computer Advances at Event
description: Startup, which aims to help patients with neurological conditions or others by decoding brain activity with technology, is set to broadcast latest update.

title: U.S. Is Pushed to Revise EV Subsidy Program
description: Officials racing to set rules for electric-vehicle subsidies are caught between clean-energy goals and the demands of allies in Europe and Asia.

title: U.S.-Backed Researchers Use AI to Probe for Weaknesses in Drug Supply Chains
description: The U.S. Department of Homeland Security has approved research that will use artificial intelligence to delve into drug supply chains and probe for weaknesses, including foreign influence.

title: Twitter's Former Trust and Safety Chief Says He Left When System of Governance Went Away
description: Yoel Roth said he departed following the botched launch of the upgraded Twitter Blue subscription program after Elon Musk ignored his team’s warnings about the rollout.
